title: Want To Buy:  .308 - 7.62 x 51 NATO FMJ Ammunition in Bulk
postcontent:
Interested in buying some factory-loaded bulk 7.62 NATO FMJ ammunition in the 140's~160's grain weight. Only interested in 200/500/1000rd bulk amounts in full metal jacket. Send me a message with what you have and please include:
-number of rounds
-brand of ammunition
-bullet grain weight
-approximate date of manufacture
-your general location in relation to the West Suburbs of the Twin Cities
-how much money you want for it...
Message along the lines of "I have 500rds of .308 Winchester, how much are you willing to spend?" will be ignored.

Surplus ammo is fine but I'm NOT interested in:
-anything steel cased
-anything with a color or animal in it's name
-expensive .308 hunting ammunition
-expensive "sniper" or "match" type ammo
-soft point/hollow point ammo
-your handloads
-a hodge-podge of 20rds of this + 105rds of that + 57rds of another brand
-paying for shipping from far away or driving 2.5 hours for 250rds of ammo. You get the idea...
Thanks!

title: For Sale:  178 rounds Aguila .22 Long Rifle Super Colibri (Quiet) Ammo
postcontent:
For Sale: 178 rounds Aguila .22 Long Rifle Super Colibri (Quiet) Ammo. $15 cash FTF, Wichita. While this is much quieter than standard .22lr, it isn't "silent," I don't care what they claim. The 20gr bullet is fired by the primer only, no gun powder. A little louder than a CO.2 pellet/BB gun.

Here's the company description:
Aguila .22 Long Rifle Super Colibri (Quiet) Ammo. This ammo is almost twice as fast as the regular Colibri and still no sound. This ammo has a 20 gr. Solid Point Lead Bullet. This ammo contains no gunpowder. The bullet is propelled solely by the eley priming mixture. This ammo is as quiet as an air rifle!!! This ammo travels at 575 FPS. This ammo is so quiet that it can be fired indoors, even in the living room, provided a proper back stop is available. The .22 super Colibri round can be fired in any .22 LR rifle or pistol. However it will not cycle the slides of semi-auto guns. WARNING: Don't let the lack of sound fool you, This round is still extremely lethal!! All safety priniciples must be used!!

title: For Sale:  Norinco ATD "takedown" 22 Semi Auto (like Browning SA22)
postcontent:
SOLD PENDING RECEIVING OF FUNDS 

Norinco copy of the famous and expensive Browning SA.22 takedown. 

Ser# 315052

These rifles are well made and reliable. Nice checkering on wood, bluing decent but some freckling in spots which seems to be normal as seen online at other Gun Selling Sites, no pitting but this rifle is used. 

Functions as new, just disassembled and thoroughly cleaned. 

Gun breaks into 2 sections via knurled nut into sections each 18" long.
Loads via tube in stock. 

Normally selling in the $250-350 range used due to being imported for a very short period in the 80's. 

Great inexpensive alternative to risking damage on your $600+ Browning. 

Excellent plinking gun and could be used for small game if your state allows semi auto rifles.  This can also be scoped by removing the rear site and installing a base that is less than $20.

This rifle is also very light and well balance for the young and small of stature.  It ejects out of the bottom so it can be shot left and right handed.

Reasonable offers considered.

Email, call or text message me REDACTED.  If you text and it takes more than 3 messages be prepared to talk.

Prefer face to face sale, must transfer at FFL, there are many in Erie County.  Shipping can be arranged, must ship to FFL, payment must be received and cleared prior to shipping.

title: For Sale:  NRA Basic Pistol Shooting Course
postcontent:
What: Basic Pistol Shooting Course

When: Sunday, 21 October 2012 at 8:00 A.M.

Where: Castlewood Rod & Gun Club
2964 Shaffer Road
New Castle, PA 16107
Directions at: http://www.castlewoodclays.com/ maps are at the bottom of page.

This class meets the requirements for getting your Florida Non-Resident CCW Permit. This will allow you to conceal carry in BOTH Pennsylvania AND Ohio.

This class will be about 10 hours long and teaches the basic knowledge, skills, and attitude for owning and operating a pistol safely. Students are to bring: Notebook with pen or pencil for taking notes; Handgun with a minimum of 1 box of ammunition (50 rounds of ammunition) for...that handgun; Complete cleaning kit to clean handgun (rod, patches, brushes, and solvent); Eye protection; Hearing protection; Appropriate clothing for current weather conditions; Personal food and drinks.

-- NO AMMUNITION WILL BE ALLOWED INTO THE CLASSROOM--
Course material will be provided at the start of the class.

This class costs $80 per person. Payment methods are: Cash, Check, or Money Order. Send initial deposit of $30 in Check or Money Order Payable to: Keystone Firearms Academy, LLC. 6 Miller Ave. New Castle, PA 16101

For those who do not have a handgun but would like to take this course in odrer to gain confidence in handgun handling prior to purchasing your first gun, I do have a few guns that I will rent out for $30. This covers the use of the gun, ammunition, and cleaning materials.

ADDITIONAL INSTRUCTION PROVIDED FOR OHIO RESIDENT CCW.

Class size is limited. To register for this course: Call: 724-698-6179 or e-mail: rogers_inc_2011@yahoo.com

title: For Sale:  Advantage Arms .22 Glock Conversion Kit
postcontent:
I have a brand new, never used Advantage Arms .22 caliber conversion kit for the Glock 26, 27, 28, & 33. These are EXTREMELY HARD TO FIND. You can find them for the fullsize glocks but this is for the subcompacts. Give me a call or text if your intrested. Save a ton of money on ammo and practice shooting your Glock. REDACTED

$380 OBO

EXCLUSIVE FEATURES OF OUR CONVERSION KIT:  Six great reasons to purchase our .22 LR conversion kit

1.  ADJUSTABLE SIGHTS
 The front and rear sights are removable GLOCK OEM sights. The rear sight is adjustable for both windage and elevation. 

2.  LAST ROUND LOCK OPEN
 The slide will lock open after the last round in the magazine has been fired. Our unique patented magazine design and heat-treated steel lock open insert allows us to offer this special and desirable feature which you can only find on 'Advantage Arms' .22LR GLOCK conversion kits.

3.  INTERNAL FIRING PIN SAFETY
 Glock incorporated an internal firing pin safety into their guns. We thought it was important enough to include it on our conversion kits as well. Our internal firing pin safety is designed to eliminate accidental discharges from dropping the firearm. 

4.  FINISH
 All Aluminum parts are Anodized Per Mil-A-8625 with a matte black finish. All steel parts are heat treated with a Black Oxide Finish. The barrel is made from heat treated 416 Stainless Steel.

5.  THE 10 SECOND INSTALLATION
 Installation is simple and does not require any modifications to your GLOCK pistol. Simply remove the GLOCK magazine and slide as outlined in your GLOCK owner's manual. Now slide the "Advantage Arms" slide onto the frame, until it engages with the slide lock. Check to make sure that the slide lock is in its most upward position. Insert the conversion magazine. You are now ready to shoot.

This procedure can be accomplished in less than 10 seconds with some practice.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Blaser, Kriss, AR Pistol, S&W, Glock, 1911, ETC
postcontent:
**First and foremost, I understand that this type of ad is out of the ordinary, and what I'm looking for might open the flood gates to many different suggestions and opinions as to what I should do. Please understand that I've done a lot of soul searching and even more research. Every person has their feelings on the matter, but what it boils down to is that this is an ad NOT a forum. While I respect every firearm owner’s opinion and their right to have one, to that same regard, I would hope that you would respect mine. Please do not respond with advice rather than a genuine offer or question about the firearms listed.***



  This is a large majority of my firearms collection. I have decided to consolidate after realizing that I am only one man and can only shoot one gun at a time. To the same respect, I'm looking to shoot more often on fewer platforms. Restricting myself to only higher quality, higher end pieces. If I diminish my collection from many to few, I want those few to be the very best out there at what they do. I like to think of myself as a VERY diverse shooter. I enjoy the sport of shooting and am open to many different venues, situations, and purposes: Home Defense, Competition, Target, Etc. With that being said...My goal is to trade up, not to sell. I have no problem offering multiple firearms in exchange for one, as long as the VALUE and QUALITY is there. Every firearm I own is in excellent condition or brand new. Nothing on this list is below 95%+ condition and most are way above (unless noted). The prices listed next to each piece are fair middle ground prices. I could start high with the expectation to be bartered with, but why not skip all the BS and cut to the chase. Please do not contact me expecting to be able to pay the lowest price listed, as again, I'm not really looking to sell. I understand that due to location and demographic, the values I have listed may be lower or higher then what is available in your area. I would like to think I am a reasonable person. If you believe I'm too low or too high please let me know and depending on what you're offering we may be able to work something out. I'm not in any hurry to get rid of any piece so please no low ball offers. I'm looking for straight value for value here. If you believe your offer to have higher than expected value, please explain why. That is why I'm here, to get the best of the best.

 What I'm looking for:

 1911's (for carry, competition, HD, etc)... Brands I'm interested in: Wilson Combat, Nighthawk Custom, Les Baer, Ed Brown, Colt, Dan Wesson. 

 AR-15 Platform (anything from LD, to target, to tactical)... Brands I'm interested in: Noveske, POF, Les Baer, Colt, Sabre, BCM, LMT

 Creative Platforms that I have interest in: Kriss Vector .45 ACP, Styer AUG, Saiga 12Ga, FN PS90, FN FS2000, FN FiveSeven, Kel-Tec KSG 12Ga, Kel-Tec RFB, Volquartsen .22 & .17

 I am an experienced shooter, but I'm far from an expert. I ALWAYS love learning about new firearms and platforms. If you have a firearm that isn't listed above, but think it meets the expectations of what I'm looking for, then please tell me about it and I would be happy to do some research.



My Current Firearms that I'm looking to trade/sell:



1. Sigarms Blaser Tactical 2 in .338 Lapua Magnum ($3600-$3900)

        26” cold hammer forged, plasma-nitrided, free float fluted barrel, threated w/thread protector

       Fiber Reinforced, Fully Adjustable, Polymer Stock

       M1913 Picantinny Rail for Optics Mount

      QD Sling Mounts

      (4)rd Mag

      Hard Case and Lock





2. Del-Ton AR-15 Pistol (92-95%) ($650-$775)

           7.5" Barrel w/ Flash Hider

        Free Float Aluminum Handguard

        Picatanny Rail Upper/Gas Block

        ErgoGrip.net Grip

        (1) 30rd Steel Mag

        Rear and Forward Sling Mounts 



3. Glock 19 Gen 3 9mm [$450-$510]

       Ext Mag Release

       Ext Slide Stop

       (2) 15rd Glock Mags

       Streamlight TLR-1 Tactical Light

       Original Case, Lock, Papers, Etc



4. Bersa Thunder 380 [$200-$250]

       All stock, Black finish

      (2) Pro Mag 8rd mags (1) Pro Mag 22rd Drum Mag

       Original Box, Lock, Frame Lock Key, Papers, Etc



5. Smith and Wesson  36-1  .38 Spec [$500-$650]

        3inch Barrel 

        Nickle Plated 

        J-Frame Square Butt

        Small Pistol Case



6. Norinco Govt Custom 1911  .45 ACP [$800-$1000]

        Hard Chrome Finish 

        Ebony Grips 

        EGW Trigger group 

        Ed Brown Grip Safety

        Ed Brown Hammer

        Ed Brown Thumb Safety

        Ed Brown Mainspring Housing 

        Vanguard Custom did install, reliability work, Slide/Frame fitting,

        and Hard Chrome Finish.

        Tagua Leather Skeleton Holster

        (1) Stainless 8rd mag, (1) Triple K 8rd mag

 7. Kriss Super V CRB/SO ($2400-$2500)

         Brand New, Unfired, Very Low Serial, Limited Edition

         Form Fitted Hardigg Storm Pelican Case

       & nbsp; Barrel Shroud

         Magpul BUIS

         Limited Otis Cleaning Kit

         TDI Forward Grip

         (2) Glock 21 Mags

         Lock, Original Paperwork, Tools

title: For Sale/Trade:  Sigarms Blaser Tactical 2 (.338 Lapua Mag)
postcontent:
I have a Like New In Case Blaser Tactical 2 chambered in .338 Lapua Mag. This is the perfect Sniper/long range system. It is designed for percision with its completely adjustable stock, fully free floated threaded and fluted barrel, crips trigger, and straight pull bolt. The is the ulitimate way to go for long range shooting. 

I'm looking to do a high end 1911/AR-15 Trade or sell for cash. I had big dreams for this rifle system. However, the cost for ammo/optic was just going to be too high for what this rifle deserves. It has had less then 20 down the pipe. Below is some info about the Blaser Tactical 2:

The Tactical 2 is the most advanced version of the precision rifle developed by Blaser.
Each design element was driven by the requirement to create the best shooting platform
possible. Exceptional accuracy was one of the key principles during development, with
effective engagement ranges of 1500 meters or more, depending on caliber and
ammunition. Advanced engineering and uncompromising quality are evident in every facet
of design. The Tactical 2 is a bolt action rifle featuring Blaser’s revolutionary straight-pull
action. When the bolt is closed, the 360 degree radial collet expands into the locking
groove in the barrel – the bolt head is auto-centering and self-headspacing. The straight
pull action features no rotating parts and assures rapid reloading with minimum
movement. The rifle can easily be converted for left or right hand shooters. Interchange
calibers by replacing the barrel and bolt head, in under a minute, without special tools
and no change in accuracy. Barrels are cold hammer forged, fluted and plasma-nitrided to
provide maximum resistance against corrosion and abrasion. An M1913 Picatinny rail is
fixed to the barrel, ensuring full compatibility with a wide range of optical sighting
systems. The muzzle end is threaded for an optional muzzle brake. The receiver is
machined from aircraft grade billet aluminum alloy and is the interface for the barrel, bolt
assembly, trigger assembly and magazine. A recoil lug of hardened steel is integrated
into the receiver. The entire unit is fixed to the stock, eliminating temperature induced
distortion. The outer surface is hard anodized. The ergonomically correct stock is injection
molded out of fiber reinforced polymers and is absolutely stable, even under extreme
temperatures.


If you have any offers or questions please feel free to email me

postcontent:
Have some really nice 8mm for sale. I bought it recently, and have shot some. The price is 35c per round, $1 for the really nice blued stripper clips, or $2.50 for a clip of five rounds. Your choice as to what manufacturer, but I have much more Romanian than Turk ammo. This is all brass cased, berdan primed, very mildly corrosive. Cases can be reloaded with the right tools. The Turk bullets are nickel, and the Romanian are copper. All Romanian ammo has a 1957 headstamp, and the Turk hovers around 1943.  Local pick-up required. Will entertain any (gun-related) trade offer.  Email me with any questions. Thanks!

DISCLAIMER: The bullets on both ammo types DO attract a magnet. This may cause the bullets to fragment or ricochet upon shooting at steel. Shoot at your own risk.

title: For Sale:  The Challenge
location: Cave City, KY, Bowling Green, Kentucky
postcontent:
Can you shoot 4 MOA rapid fire without a bipod or rest?  Can you do it with a rack-grade rifle and surplus ammo?  Can you do it with iron sights?  Join us for an Appleseed Rifle Marksmanship clinic and find out.

See if you can answer these questions - which every American who loves his country should be able to answer:
1. When and where was the American Revolution won, according to John Adams?
2. When and where did the Revolutionary War break out?
3. What caused the British Regulars, the most well-trained, well-disciplined army in the world, to break and run at Concord's North Bridge, after only two minutes of musket fire by shopkeepers and farmers?
4.  What caused this reversal of British military opinion:

BEFORE April 19, 1775:
"Americans are raw, undisciplined and cowardly". John Montagu, 4th Earl of Sandwich and 1st Lord of the Admiralty 

"With a thousand British grenadiers I would undertake to go from one end of America to the other and geld all the males, partly by force and partly with a little coaxing". Major General Alured Clarke 

AFTER April 19, 1775:
"Whoever looks upon them as an irregular mob, will find himself very much mistaken. They have men amongst them who know very well what they are about..." Lieutenant-General Hugh Percy, 2nd Duke of Northumberland

Join us for the Appleseed Rifle Marksmanship Clinic, Oct 6-7, 2012 at the American Institute of Marksmanship in Cave City, KY and find out the answers to these basic questions about our country's founding.

National Website: http://appleseedinfo.org/smf/index.php?topic=26955.0

Kentucky Appleseed Facebook Page: http://www.facebook.com/KentuckyRifleman

title: For Sale/Trade:  FLIR Themal Binocular: Scout BTS-X Pro NTSC
postcontent:
These are normally $7,000 - $8,000 without a lens, and over $10,000 with one depending on where you shop.

I've got a FLIR BTS-X Pro with a QD35mm Lens for sale together. I've had these for 3 months, its amazing technology that works great, but I'm moving to a short-range handheld unit for work now, and get don't get time to shoot long distance like I used to.

This is a binocular thermal unit from FLIR, the guys who invented Thermal Imagers, so no ATN or some chinese make. 

It's got a 320x240 detector inside it, which when combined with the 35mm lens lets you detect a mansized heat signature at 780 yards regardless of night or day. The company says if you upgrade to a 100mm lens that increases out to over two thousand yards easy, so this is LONG range detection.

Price is negotiable, and I am interested in other night vision trades. If I were to divide up the lens and the imager I'd put the imager at $4500 and the lens at $2000. I will pay shipping to anywhere in the continental US. 

I'm pretty open to questions, so feel free to ask.

title: For Sale:  LIke New in box CIA Zastava PAP AK-47
location: East Louisville - Near Crestwood, Louisville, Kentucky
postcontent:
The newest CIA Zastava PAP is a 7.62x39 mm auto-loading rifle that is manufactured at the Zastava Arms Factory in Serbia. The gun is all new with no surplus or used parts used. It has a Chromed Barrel and Bolt. It also includes a picatinny rail mounted on the dust cover which is OK for mounting some sighting systems, but will not sustain zero because of the inherent loose fitting dust covers on some of the rifles. I added the side mount because it allowed the mounting of most optics and will sustain zero much better since it is an integral part of the rifle. 
I have had it to the range one time and have run ~20 or so rounds through it (3-5 rounds each in various mags to make sure it would use other mags than came with it... I found that metal mags work fine, but plastic mags are a little too tight a fit...close tolerances, I guess)
Price is 1050.00 with the AimPoint...
I would take the AimPoint off if the buyer did not want the optics and sell for $695.00 
I would prefer cash for the rifle, but would entertain trades of equal or higher value or trades plus cash. 
I don't need to sell the rifle, so low ball offers will simply be ignored.
